intro: Corydalis meifolia var. ecristata, commonly known as the white-flowered corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive, early spring blossoms.
